page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY.
page.content: Ballast was vital to survival and 70,000 tons came annually into the town during the 19 Century.The Ballast Bank contained over 1 million tons of of ballast was brought from many parts of the world but chiefly from Ireland.Troon was fast becoming a very important sea/port.The sea wall was rebuilt,the berth dredged providing a depth of 20 feet at low tide.Imports between 1902 and 1914 proved that Troon was a viable port.Over 1250000 tons of iron ore were discharged during this period.The ore was bought by Lugar Irvine, and Dalmellington.The port was favoured by Mediterranean commerce.The skippers from Quebec in Canada,hibernated at Troon when the St.Lawrence was closed with ice.Thus,Troon became a port used by ships from all over the world.More about the port in further texts......t
